Heals all nearby friendly units that are out of combat by +6 every 1 seconds. May also Crown a King, a powerful cavalry leader with an out of combat healing aura.
Acts as an Archery Range with all units and technologies. Works +100% faster.
Acts as a Town Center with all the behaviors, technology, units, and bonuses.
Acts as a Keep with all the behaviors, technologies, and bonuses. Works 100% faster.
Acts as a Keep with increased health and powerful incendiary arrows. All weapons have 15 tiles of range.
Allows production of 4 battalions: Wynguard Army, Wynguard Rangers, and Wynguard Raiders, and Wynguard Footmen.
Produces melee infantry units.
Produces ranged infantry units.
Produces cavalry military units.
Houses technology to improve infantry and cavalry.
Produces siege engines and powerful gunpowder units.
Produces naval units. Automatically repairs nearby damaged naval units. Capable of holding up to three Fishing Ships.
Villagers can drop off Food at this building. Houses technologies to improve Food gathering.
Villagers can drop off Wood at this building. Houses technologies to improve Wood gathering.
Villagers can drop off Stone and Gold at this building. Houses technologies to improve mining.
Increases your maximum Population.
Light defensive wall for quickly fortifying an area. Initially costs 21 Wood, with each additional section costing 7 Wood.
Light defensive gate. Must be built on a Palisade Wall segment.
Offers extensive line of sight. Can be upgraded with weaponry and fortifications. Attacks while garrisoned.
Allows the buying and selling of resources and produces the Trader.
Sturdy wall that cannot be attacked by torches. units on walls take 66% less damage from ranged attacks and their range is increased by +2.
Heavy defensive gate. Must be built on a Stone Wall segment. Infantry can use the gate to access the top of the walls.
Heavy defensive tower that fires a springald. Must be built on a Stone Wall segment. Infantry can use the tower to access the top of the walls.
Heavy garrison and defensible position. Can be upgraded with weaponry. Adds additional attacks while garrisoned.
Produces religious units and houses religious technologies. Starting in the Castle Age (III), religious units can pick up Relics and place them in this building to generate Gold.
Houses advanced technology that benefit the civilization.
Increase the melee damage of all non-siege units by +1.
Increase the melee damage of all non-siege units by +1.
Increase the melee damage of all non-siege units by +1.
Increase the ranged damage of all non-siege units and buildings by +1.
Increase the ranged damage of all non-siege units and buildings by +1.
Increase the ranged damage of all non-siege units and buildings by +1.
Increase the melee armor of all non-siege units by +1.
Increase the melee armor of all non-siege units by +1.
Increase the melee armor of all non-siege units by +1.
Increase the ranged armor of all non-siege units by +1.
Increase the ranged armor of all non-siege units by +1.
Increase the ranged armor of all non-siege units by +1.
Melee and ranged infantry can construct Siege Towers and Battering Rams in the field.
Increase the production speed of infantry, cavalry, siege, and transport units at buildings by 33%. Does not affect religious units or other support units.
Increase the weapon range of Springalds by +2 tiles and increase their attack speed by +25%.
Increase the attack speed of Mangonels by +25%.
Trebuchet projectiles shatter on impact, increasing their area of effect.
Increase the movement speed of siege engines by +15%.
Increase damage of Trebuchets by +20%.
Increase Battering Ram attack speed by +40% and reduce their field construction time by -50%.
Increase Villagers' gathering rate for Food by 15%. Does not apply to hunted meat.
Increase Villagers' gathering rate for Food by 15%. Does not apply to hunted meat.
Increase Villagers' gathering rate for Food by 15%. Does not apply to hunted meat.
Increase the carry capacity of Villagers by +5 and their movement speed by +15%.
Increase Villagers' hunted meat gather rate by +15%.
Scouts gain the ability to carry animal carcasses and +100% damage against wild animals. Scouts move -35% slower while carrying and cannot pick up Boar.
Each Farm Enclosure being worked by a Villager generates +1 Gold every 5 seconds.
Double the rate at which Villagers chop down trees.
Increase Villagers' gathering rate for Wood by 15%.
Increase Villagers' gathering rate for Wood by 15%.
Increase Villagers' gathering rate for Wood by 15%.
Increase Villagers' gathering rate for Gold and Stone by 15%.
Increase Villagers' gathering rate for Gold and Stone by 15%.
Increase Villagers' gathering rate for Gold and Stone by 15%.
Add +1000 health and +5 fire armor to this Outpost.
Add defensive arrowslits to this structure and increase garrison arrow range by +1. Only one weapon emplacement can be added.
Add a defensive springald emplacement to this structure.
Add a defensive cannon emplacement to this structure.

Traders generate Gold when assigned to trade with a Trade Post or another playerâ€™s Market. The distance between the trade target and Market determines the amount of Gold. Once assigned to trade, the Trader makes repeated trips between its Home Market and the trade target. You can assign a new Home Market if you wish to.
Increase the Network of Castles attack speed bonus from +20% to +40%.
Towers and Keeps gain a boiling oil attack against nearby units that deals 30 damage.
Increase the healing rate of religious units by +60%.
Increase the health of religious units by +40.
Relics placed in a Monastery provide an income of +30 Food, +30 Wood, and +30 Stone every minute.
Increase the damage of gunpowder units by +20%.
Increase the health of siege engines by +20% and their ranged armor by +10.
Increase the health of all cavalry by +20%.
Increase the damage of ranged units by +20%. Does not apply to gunpowder units.
Increase the health of all buildings by +30%.
Increase the health of all melee infantry by +20% and their damage by +20%.
Produces an army including two Spearmen, two Crossbowmen, and a Trebuchet.
Produces an army of 3 Horsemen and 3 Knights.
Produces an army of 6 Wynguard Rangers.
Produces an army of 6 Wynguard Footmen.
